definitions.definition: The point where two components of a structure join, but are still able to rotate .
examples: This rod is free to swing at the joint with the platform.

definitions.definition: The point where two components of a structure join rigidly .
examples: The water is leaking out of the joint between the two pipes.

definitions.definition: Any part of an animalian body where two bones or exoskeleton segments are abutted , in most cases allowing that part of the body to be bent or straightened .
The means of securing together the meeting surfaces of components of a structure.
examples: The dovetail joint , while more difficult to make, is also quite strong.

definitions.definition: A cut of meat , especially (but not necessarily) (a) one containing a joint in the sense of an articulation or (b) one rolled up and tied.
examples: Set the joint in a roasting tin and roast for the calculated cooking time.

definitions.definition: The part or space included between two joints, knots, nodes, or articulations.
examples: a joint of cane or of a grass stem; a joint of the leg

definitions.definition: A fracture in which the strata are not offset; a geologic joint .

A place of business , particularly in the food service or hospitality industries ; sometimes extended to any place that is a focus of human connection or activity (e.g., schools, hangouts, party spots).
examples: It was the kind of joint you wouldn't want your boss to see you in.

subdefinitions.definition: A place of resort for tramps .

examples: I'm just trying to stay out of the joint .

definitions.label_groups: chiefly US slang , may be somewhat derogatory

examples: After locking the door and closing the shades, they lit the joint .

definitions.definition: A syringe used to inject an illicit drug .

main_definition: The point where two components of a structure join, but are still able to rotate .
secondary_definitions: The point where two components of a structure join rigidly .
( anatomy ) Any part of an animalian body where two bones or exoskeleton segments are abutted , in most cases allowing that part of the body to be bent or straightened .
The means of securing together the meeting surfaces of components of a structure.
A cut of meat , especially (but not necessarily) (a) one containing a joint in the sense of an articulation or (b) one rolled up and tied.
The part or space included between two joints, knots, nodes, or articulations.
( geology ) A fracture in which the strata are not offset; a geologic joint .

( chiefly US slang , may be somewhat derogatory ) A place of business , particularly in the food service or hospitality industries ; sometimes extended to any place that is a focus of human connection or activity (e.g., schools, hangouts, party spots).
( slang , dated ) A syringe used to inject an illicit drug .
( originally an idiolectic sense ) A thing .
